solution.text:
Given expression is :
\(_{j}_ + _{j}_sec(A)\over sec(A)\)
Take _{j}_ common from numerator
\(_{j}_(1 + sec(A))\over sec(A)\)
now write sec(A) in the form of cos(A)
\({{(_{j}_)(1 + {1\over cos(A)}})\over {1\over cos(A)}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \)\(_{j}_(cos(A)+1)\over 1\)
now multiply numerator and denominator by (1-cos(A))
which gives
\(_{j}_(1+cos(A))*(1-cos(A))\over 1-cos(A)\)
\(_{j}_(1-cos^2(A))\over 1-cos(A)\)
we know \(sin^2(A)=1-cos^2(A)\)
\(_{j}_sin^2(A)\over 1-cos(A)\)

content.text:
Find out the correct answer for given expression
\(_{j}_ + _{j}_sec(A)\over sec(A)\)
